Perbankan Siap Turunkan Suku Bunga Kredit
07 Nov 2019, 01:43 by Antara, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Sejumlah perbankan menyatakan siap menurunkan tingkat suku bunga kredit sebagai respons kebijakan Bank Indonesia (BI) yang memangkas suku bunga acuan hingga 100 basis poin (bps) pada 2019 ini.
Direktur Utama BRI Sunarso dalam acara Indonesia Banking Expo (IBEX) 2019 di Jakarta, Rabu, 6 November 2019 mengatakan bahwa penurunan suku bunga BI cepat atau lambat akan ditranmisikan ke jalur suku bunga bank. Namun, hal itu membutuhkan waktu.
"Pasti akan turun, tinggal time lag-nya itu berapa. Misalnya, suku bunga turun hari ini, tapi kita kan masih punya dana yang tenornya paling cepat satu bulan. Jadi, kita masih punya liabilitas yang jatuh temponya satu bulan. Artinya, itu masih butuh transmisi dan butuh waktu," ujarnya.
Ia menambahkan penurunan suku bunga bank juga akan mengikuti mekanisme pasar, sehingga tidak ada alasan bagi perbankan menahan suku bunganya. "Jadi bank follow trade, kalau pasar turun tidak ada alasan bagi kita tidak turunkan," ucapnya.
Selain mekanisme pasar, lanjut dia, terdapat juga mekanisme diluar pasar, yaitu regulated price. Contohnya Kredit Usaha Rakyat (KUR) yang memiliki suku bunga sebesar tujuh persen, lebih rendah dibandingkan suku bunga lainnya yang di atas 10 persen. "Mana ada bisa berikan suku bunga tujuh persen kalau mengikuti pasar," katanya.
Sementara itu, Presiden Direktur PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA) Jahja Setiaatmadja menyampaikan bahwa pihaknya bakal menunkan suku bunga secara perlahan. "Akan tetapi, jangan ada argumentasi bahwa suku bunga turun kredit pasti naik, itu belum tentu," ucapnya.
Dalam IBEX 2019 itu, Presiden Joko Widodo mengajak para pelaku industri perbankan untuk menurunkan suku bunga kredit. "Saya mengajak serius memikirkan untuk menurunkan suku bunga kredit. Masa negara lain sudah turun turun turun, BI rate sudah turun, banknya belum? Saya tunggu," kata Jokowi.

Banking Ready to Lower Credit Interest Rates
Nov 7 2019, 01:43 by Antara, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - A number of banks have expressed their readiness to reduce lending rates in response to Bank Indonesia (BI) policy which cut the benchmark interest rate to 100 basis points (bps) in 2019.
BRI President Director Sunarso in the 2019 Indonesia Banking Expo (IBEX) event in Jakarta, Wednesday, November 6, 2019 said that a reduction in BI interest rates would sooner or later be transmitted to the bank interest rate channel. However, that takes time.
"It will definitely go down, how much is the time lag. For example, interest rates are down today, but we still have funds with a tenor of one month at the fastest. So, we still have liabilities with a maturity of one month. need transmission and need time, "he said.
He added that the decline in bank interest rates will also follow market mechanisms, so there is no reason for banks to hold interest rates. "So banks follow trade, if the market goes down there is no reason for us not to go down," he said.
In addition to market mechanisms, he continued, there are also outside market mechanisms, namely regulated prices. For example People's Business Credit (KUR), which has an interest rate of seven percent, lower than other interest rates above 10 percent. "Where can you give a seven percent interest rate if you follow the market," he said.
Meanwhile, President Director of PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA) Jahja Setiaatmadja said that his party would slowly lower interest rates. "However, there should be no argument that interest rates on credit drops must go up, that's not necessarily," he said.
In IBEX 2019, President Joko Widodo invited banking industry players to reduce lending rates. "I invite seriously to think about lowering lending rates. The period of other countries has gone down and down, the BI rate has gone down, the bank hasn't? I'm waiting," Jokowi said.
